content:
OracleBinary Struct

Definition

Represents a variable-length stream of binary data to be stored in or retrieved from a database.

In this Article

public struct OracleBinary : IComparable, System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
OracleBinary

Remarks

To obtain an OracleBinary object, call the GetOracleBinary method.

Constructors

OracleBinary(Byte[])

Initializes a new instance of the OracleBinary structure, setting the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value* property to the contents of the supplied byte array.

public OracleBinary (byte[] b);
b
Byte[]

The byte array to be stored in the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value* property.

Fields

Null

Represents a null value that can be assigned to the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value* property of an OracleBinary structure.

public static readonly System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary Null;

Remarks

Null functions as a constant for the OracleBinary structure.

Properties

IsNull

Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value* property of the OracleBinary structure is null.

public bool IsNull { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if Value is null, otherwise false.

Item(Int32)

Gets the single byte from the Value property located at the position indicated by the integer parameter, index. If index indicates a position beyond the end of the byte array, an exception is raised.

public byte this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The position of the byte to be retrieved.

Value
Byte

The byte located at the position indicated by the integer parameter.

Remarks

To avoid raising an OracleNullValueException, always check the IsNull property and the Length property before reading this.

Length

Gets the length in bytes of the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value* property. This property is read-only.

public int Length { get; }
Value
Int32

The length of the binary data in the Value property.

Remarks

To avoid raising an OracleNullValueException, always check the IsNull property before reading the Length property.

Value

Gets the value of the OracleBinary structure. This property is read-only.

public byte[] Value { get; }
Value
Byte[]

The value of the OracleBinary structure.

Remarks

To avoid raising an OracleNullValueException, always check the IsNull property before reading the Value property.

Methods

CompareTo(Object)

Compares this OracleBinary object to the supplied object and returns an indication of their relative values.

public int CompareTo (object obj);
obj
Object

The object to be compared to this OracleBinary structure.

Returns
Int32

A signed number indicating the relative values of this OracleBinary structure and the object.

Return Value
 Condition
Less than zero
 The value of this OracleBinary object is less than the object.
Zero
 This OracleBinary object is the same as the object.
Greater than zero
 This OracleBinary object is greater than the object.
-or-
The object is a null reference.

Concat(OracleBinary,OracleBinary)

Concatenates two OracleBinary structures to create a new OracleBinary structure.

public static System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary Concat (System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary x, System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary y);
x
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure.

y
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure.

Returns
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure with the concatenated values of the x and y parameters.

Equals(Object)

Compares the supplied object parameter to the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value* property of the OracleBinary object.

public override bool Equals (object value);
value
Object

The object to be compared.

Returns
Boolean

true if object is an instance of OracleBinary and the two are equal; otherwise false.

Equals(OracleBinary,OracleBinary)

Compares two OracleBinary structures to determine if they are equal.

public static System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean Equals (System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary x, System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary y);
x
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure.

y
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure.

Returns
OracleBoolean

An OracleBoolean that is OracleBoolean if the two instances are equal or OracleBoolean if the two instances are not equal. If either instance of OracleBinary is null, the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value* of the OracleBoolean will be Null.

GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this OracleBinary structure.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

GreaterThan(OracleBinary,OracleBinary)

Compares two OracleBinary structures to determine if the first is greater than the second.

public static System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean GreaterThan (System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary x, System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary y);
x
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure.

y
OracleBinary

An OracleBinary structure.

Returns
OracleBoolean

An OracleBoolean that is OracleBoolean if the first instance is greater than the second instance, otherwise OracleBoolean. If either instance of OracleBinary is null, the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value* of the OracleBoolean will be Null.

Compares two OracleBinary structures to determine if the first is greater than or equal to the second.

public static System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean GreaterThanOrEqual (System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary x, System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary y);
x

OracleBoolean

An OracleBoolean that is OracleBoolean if the first instance is greater than or equal to the second instance, otherwise OracleBoolean. If either instance of OracleBinary is null, the stem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value* of the OracleBoolean will be Null.

Operators

op_Addition(OracleBinary,OracleBinary)

Concatenates the two OracleBinary parameters to create a new OracleBinary structure.

public static System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary op_Addition (System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary x, System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary y);
x

y

OracleBinary

The concatenated values of the x and y parameters.

Remarks

x will appear first in the resulting OracleBinary, followed by y.

[Visual Basic]

In Visual Basic, you can use the operators defined by a class, but you cannot override them or create your own.
